VIII.i.2.B.2.d
.
Example 3 on Establishing a Retroactive Effective Date:  Claim for DIC Received Within One Year of the Veteran’s Death
Situation
:  On November 3, 1986, a Veteran who served in the Republic of Vietnam (RVN) during the Vietnam era died from Hodgkin’s disease.  His surviving spouse’s claim for DIC benefits was received on December 10, 1986, and denied on February 12, 1987.  The surviving spouse reopened her claim on March 15, 1993.
Result
:  Establish entitlement to DIC benefits from November 1, 1986, the first day of the month in which the Veteran died.
Rationale
:  Since the claim for DIC benefits was received within one year of the Veteran’s death, the effective date is governed by
38 CFR 3.400(b)(2)
.
